[b][color=white]Refer Members for 100 Bytes[/color][/b]

Now referring a member to the Forum with your Referral Link will earn you 100 Bytes only if you are eligible to earn them. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5873577]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]SoundCloud MyCode[/color][/b]

Users can now use MyCode for SoundCloud once again. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5920015]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Upgrade Feature: Thread PDF Export[/color][/b]

Upgraded members can now export their thread(s) in a PDF format. This feature was disabled for a few years, but now it's back again. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5920081]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Official Country Code Lock Back[/color][/b]

Upgraded Members can now use the Country Code Lock feature, once again. This feature was disabled due to issues with IPv6 and inaccurate Geo IP locating. The current GEO IP uses a different API, and now it's entirely accurate. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5920137]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1034038][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/sciencenews-saltpeter.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Fentanyl is now the Most Deadly Drug in America[/color][/b] 
Usurping heroin, Fentanyl is now the drug most associated in fatal cases of overdose stateside from a National Vital Statistics System report. You may now be wondering what Fentanyl is if you had not heard of it prior, Fentanyl is a synthetic pain reliever made to be around a hundred times more potent than morphine. The report also commented that this morbid statistic is not showing any signs of slowing. This study also illustrates how much the drug use of a country can shift in just a few short years, It also cautions us of the dangers these synthetic pain relievers possess. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2018/12/12/676214086/fentanyl-surpasses-heroin-as-drug-most-often-involved-in-deadly-overdoses]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Zero Reason to Avoid Exersize[/color][/b] 
Among the top sleep researchers, the belief has been held that avoiding exercise in the evening would improve sleeping habits. However, that has been proven to not entirely be the case by researchers at the Institute of Human Movement Sciences and Sport at ETH Zurich. The team analyzed a plethora of prior studies on the subject and came to a conclusion that is most accurately summarized by the following quote “If doing sport in the evening has any effect on sleep quality at all, it’s rather a positive effect, albeit only a mild one,” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.ethz.ch/en/news-and-events/eth-news/news/2018/12/physical-activity-in-the-evening-does-not-cause-sleep-problems.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1034038][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/worldnews-lukas.png[/img][/url][/align]
[i][14 Dec. 2018][/i]

[b][color=white]US-backed fighters in Syria capture final stronghold held by ISIS[/color][/b]
Kurdish-led fighters capture ISIS’ last stronghold on Friday, nearly three months after nonstop warfare. The town Islamic State held, Hajin, was their main [i]hub[/i] in the remaining “pocket of land” controlled by the extremist group in eastern Syria; they still hold smaller, closer nearby villages. The Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) have been fighting for the control of Hajin for the past three months. In recent weeks, offense on both ends has intensified with the arrival of reinforcements. “The Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said the SDF took Hajin early in the morning, after fierce fighting under the cover of airstrikes by the U.S.-led coalition. It said some ISIS fighters withdrew to the villages and that fighting is still going in the fields outside Hajin as SDF fighters chase the extremists.”

Activist Omar Abu Layla from Europe’s DeiEzzor 24 monitoring group confirmed that the US-backed fighters have successfully overtaken the key town, adding that some ISIS extremists are still trapped “in small pockets on the edge of Hajin.” It’s stated that the militants slayed over 900 ISIS fighters in the heroically ferocious capture of the group’s then-largest camp. Unfortunately, the victory did come at a price. Although the total amount of US soldiers killed in action has yet to been released, Abdel Rahman, head of the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, said that approximately 500 SDF fights have been confirmed deceased as a result of the three-month battle between the jihadis. Rahman further stated that over 320 civilians were killed as well – many as a result of airstrikes led by the US coalition. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/u-s-backed-fighters-syria-capture-last-town-held-isis-n947851?cid=sm_npd_nn_fb_ma]>>Source[/url][/size][/i] [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6495483/US-backed-fighters-capture-largest-remaining-town-held-ISIS-Syria-fierce-fighting.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[i][14 Dec. 2018][/i]

[b][color=white]Over 1,000 institutions pledge to withdraw fossil fuel investments[/color][/b] 
On Friday, the news publishing agency [b]Independent[/b] submitted an article on the withdrawal of investments on fossil fuel, stating that “Governments, universities and banks have quit fossil fuels in their hundreds after a global campaign to convince institutions to pull their investments.” Since the campaign to withdraw from fossil fuels has started, the total sum of money being withdrawn is approaching the $8 trillion mark. Pressure is being mounted on countries and businesses to eradicate fossil fuels entirely, where scientists warned it is the only way to avoid a global disaster caused by intense climate change within decades. Despite this, efforts to reach a mutual agreement amongst UN nations have stalled at the COP24 summit, where negotiators failed to reach an agreement on green finance. 

While diplomats at the UN climate talks are stalled and have a hard time reaching a mutual compromise, large companies have not stalled; they are actively storing fossil fuels in the ground. Pledges to move from fossil fuels now spans across 37 countries, including major cities as well, such as New York, along with mainstream banks and insurance agencies. In July 2018, Ireland became the world’s first country to take a stand against fossil fuel and sell its components in the country’s $9 billion national investment fund. The campaigners, ranging from faith organizations such as [b]the Quakers and the Church of England[/b] to insurance companies all agree on the mutual statement that their goal is to contribute to the weakening of the fossil fuel industry by initiating a call to action to the people that hurt our planet. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.independent.co.uk/environment/fossil-fuels-divest-climate-change-global-warming-emissions-campaign-a8681931.html?utm_source=reddit.com]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2295175][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/technews-stratify.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Tumblr porn ban now in full effect[/color][/b] 
Tumblr, once renowned for its lewd content, has finally put an end to sharing explicit images on the website. Whilst the site no longer allows this material, all existing posts are still accessible but hidden to all users unless they have a direct link to the images. The decision of the ban by Tumblr came last month when the Tumblr app was removed from the Apple App Store for illegal content. One week later, Tumblr announced the ban. New guidelines prohibit genitalia, sex acts and illustrations on the website and Tumblr have been said to have worked on an algorithm to stop anybody trying to pass their filter. Many users of the platform were left unhappy at Tumblr staff who say that their approach was simply too harsh and that they could have simply devoted more time on cracking down on illegal material. Many Tumblr users have now moved onto other platforms which raises the question of if this is the end of Tumblr's popularity. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/12/17/18141106/tumblr-porn-ban-adult-content-appeal]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Russia used Social Media to aid Trump's 2016 Presidential Campaign[/color][/b] 
According to The Washington Post, a report studied has revealed millions of social media posts on a variety of social media from Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and others in order to aid Donald Trump's 2016 US presidential campaign. It's clear from this report that social media has become a place for Russia to manipulate people on a mass scale, using thousands of fake accounts with messages about party conventions and presidential debates at key moments in the campaign. These posts made by Russians on social media were targeted at African American voters by spreading misinformation about Trump's opposing candidates. The report says Russia has a prime focus on targeting those with posts on immigration, race and gun rights. This concerning the use of social media has raised questions whether prime websites such as Facebook should review and censor certain posts about politics from Russian propaganda groups. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-46590890]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
posts.subject: RE: Hack Forums News // Edition 421

posts.message:
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium][color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/3.png[/img][/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1705027][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/darkops-business.png[/img][/url][/align]

[align=center][color=#95a7c4][size=small]TOPIC:[/size] [i][size=large]What is your favorite HF News section? How often do you read HF News?[/size][/i][/color][/align]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"In order of my biggest favorite to least favorite User news, headlines, dark ops, notable threads, interviews, all the rest lol. I've read every edition for the past few months."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2028907][color=#95a7c4]Lavish Living[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"My favourite section of the news is the reporting section since it keeps me up to date on all the gosip."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1661823][color=#95a7c4]Dredd[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"Headlines, Comics, World News, Science News. Weekly"[/color][/size]
~[i][color=#888888]Anonymous[/color][/i]

      

[align=center][color=#95a7c4][size=small]TOPIC:[/size] [i][size=large]What's your opinion on "lounge-heads"? Do you think they contribute in any way?[/size][/i][/color][/align]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"Sure, they contribute to bytes farming and the overall forum engagement/statistics numbers. They certainly don't HURT hackforums in anyway... imo. If they wanna spend their time socializing and lounging away, then more power to them lol."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2028907][color=#95a7c4]Lavish Living[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"That question could spark a quantity vs. quality debate. They provide a good amount of posts, but are they even worth reading?"[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1034038][color=#95a7c4]Lukas[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"I myself am a lounge head with over 5k posts in the lounge, we help keep activity up and create interesting and sometimes somewhat silly discussions. But without us HF would be a boring and dull place!"[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1661823][color=#95a7c4]Dredd[/color][/url][/i]

      

[align=center][color=#95a7c4][size=small]TOPIC:[/size] [i][size=large]What Bytes game/feature do you want to see next?[/size][/i][/color][/align]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"Integrated bytes poker, or any player vs player game honestly (preferably one that can utilize skill and strategy rather than pure luck)."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2028907][color=#95a7c4]Lavish Living[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"I would like to see a coin toss between users. I.E. I challenge another user to a 500 byte coin toss and it's fifty fifty I double my bytes or they do."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1661823][color=#95a7c4]Dredd[/color][/url][/i]

[size=medium][color=#ffffff]"N/L Texas Holdem. Achieves live scheduled engagement, something I think HF would benefit from."[/color][/size]
~[i][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1011113][color=#95a7c4]Dan.[/color][/url][/i]

      

[align=center][color=#888888][i][size=x-large]Let us know what your opinion is, uncensored. [url=https://hfnt.typeform.com/to/dHd2NV]Begin here.[/url][/size][/i][/color][/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]
